channel.title: Adding some stuff
channel.description: Ok well I am using a deltascape based source and I was wanting to put some d claws and d plates.....all the new item and some of my own creation. Is there anyway I can put D claws in with the spec and fully operational??

item.title: Adding some stuff
item.dc:creator: @b_b0yz_4 b b0yz 4
item.description:
@b_b0yz_4 wrote:

oh ok thanks! But what about the special? For the D claws?[br][br][size=1]Posted on: June 29, 2009, 01:43:25 pm[/size][hr]I tryed what you (client class) said and it still says it is a non existing item an wont atack like a claw would. Should I use the non-silab or silab bronze claws.

Read full topic

item.title: Adding some stuff
item.dc:creator: @client_class client class
item.description:
@client_class wrote:

Easy. Just search up the item in item.cfg that you replaced the d plate/claws with, and put “Dragon Platebody”. If you didn’t replace an item, replace it with, lets say, a bronze chainbody.

Read full topic

item.title: Adding some stuff
item.dc:creator: @b_b0yz_4 b b0yz 4
item.description:
@b_b0yz_4 wrote:

Yes! Thank You! But now can you help me with another problem I got? When I went to the “Choose attack style” tab it says it is a non-existing item soo I need to fix that and I need to make it so its works like in real rs.

Read full topic

item.title: Adding some stuff
item.dc:creator: @xxDiluted2xx xxDiluted2xx
item.description:
@xxDiluted2xx wrote:

No, take the models in your folder (In your client folder) And make a backup folder to put them in, now. After you’ve done that. Delete ALL the models in your client model folder. Then take my folders’ models, copy all of them, and paste it into your model folder. Make sure to make a backup text document for your class8.java file to. It should work fine. Compile and done.

Read full topic

item.title: Adding some stuff
item.dc:creator: @b_b0yz_4 b b0yz 4
item.description:
@b_b0yz_4 wrote:

Ok I downloaded the models. Now I am supposed to find the model of the item in the file I downloaded?

Read full topic

item.title: Adding some stuff
item.dc:creator: @xxDiluted2xx xxDiluted2xx
item.description:
@xxDiluted2xx wrote:

b b0yz 4:

Where can I get the model from?? I mainly want the d claws so how could i get the model for those then make it so it works like it actually does in rs?

Download this file, and take all the models out of your client, paste them into a folder for keeping, if you just want the dragon platebody, and the claws. Download all of these models, and stick them into your models folder onto your client, compile, rerun, and it should work.

  • http://uppit.com/v/7ZOK9VMH

If you simply dislike the models, just take them out, and put your old ones back in. If you want all the custom items to put in your Class8.Java file. Download this and paste it into there. Again, if you don’t like the custom items, just replace them with your old Class8.Java file.

-http://uppit.com/v/4E8D1E3X

Make sure to make a backup folder with your old models and Class8.Java, or you can make a test client. (:

Read full topic

body?[/quote]

Just simply add the model to the model folder, but it’s complicating.

item.title: Adding some stuff
item.dc:creator: @xxDiluted2xx xxDiluted2xx
item.description:
@xxDiluted2xx wrote:

[quote=“b b0yz 4, post:3, topic:286089”]Ok, I will add them and I have 1 more noob question.

What are models?[br][br][size=1]Posted on: June 29, 2009, 12:21:39 pm[/size][hr]Nevermind. I kinda figured out what the models were when i wielded and wore them lol.[/quote]

Models are used to identify the item basicly. You can’t see the item picture, or when you wield it you will have a glitch. The model contains the GFX look of it. And what it looks like, basicly, this is a Dragon Platebody. In model for.

You see, you need the model for it to look right, and for the appearence basicly.

Read full topic

item.title: Adding some stuff
item.dc:creator: @xxDiluted2xx xxDiluted2xx
item.description:
@xxDiluted2xx wrote:

That’s really based on the client, and the model you use for it. I would reccomend adding this in Class8.java for just the item itself.

-Claws

if(i == 13664){
class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5];
class8.aStringArray189[1] = "Wear";
class8.anInt174 = 13699;
class8.anInt165 = 13698;
class8.anInt200 = 13698;
class8.anInt181 = 730;
class8.anInt190 = 268;
class8.anInt198 = 2000;
class8.anInt169 = -1;
class8.anInt194 = -1;
class8.aBoolean176 = false;
class8.aString170 = "Dragon Claws";
class8.aByteArray178 = "Wouldn't want to get scratched by a pair of these!".getBytes();
}

-Plate

if(i == 13665){
class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5];
class8.aStringArray189[1] = "Wield";
class8.anIntArray156 = new int[2];
class8.anIntArray160 = new int[2];
class8.anIntArray156[0] = 43072;
class8.anIntArray160[0] = 925;
class8.anIntArray156[1] = 4550;
class8.anIntArray160[1] = 925;
class8.anInt174 = 27;
class8.anInt181 = 1330;
class8.anInt190 = 310;
class8.anInt198 = 1800;
class8.anInt169 = 0;
class8.anInt194 = 1;
class8.anInt165 = 28;
class8.anInt200 = 28;
class8.anInt164 = 29;
class8.anInt188 = 29;
class8.aBoolean176 = false;
class8.aString170 = "Dragon Platebody";
class8.aByteArray178 = "Provides excellent protection".getBytes();
}

Need the models? Pm me.

Read full topic
